channel.title: UK on The Encryption Compendium
channel.description: Recent content in UK on The Encryption Compendium

item.title: Ex-MI5 chief warns against crackdown on encrypted messaging apps
item.description: Published: August 2017 URL: https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/aug/11/ex-mi5-chief-warns-against-crackdown-encrypted-messaging-apps Abstract: Jonathan Evans says although encryption services have hampered terrorism fight he does not support curtailment of its use

item.title: Former GCHQ boss backs end-to-end encryption
item.description: Authors: John Leyden Published: July 2017 URL: https://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/07/10/former_gchq_wades_into_encryption_debate/ Abstract: Target the target’s device, advises former spy chief

item.title: Revealed: how US and UK spy agencies defeat internet privacy and security
The Five Eyes Statement on Encryption: Things Are Seldom What They Seem
item.description: Published: September 2018 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/five-eyes-statement-encryption-things-are-seldom-what-they-seem Abstract: Earlier this September, law enforcement officials from the Five Eyes intelligence alliance—made up of Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, and the United States—met in Australia and issued a Statement of Principles on Access to Evidence and Encryption.

item.title: “Five Eyes” Governments Respond to Coalition Demands to Stop Undermining Encryption
item.description: Authors: Amie Stepanovich, Bennett Cyphers Published: October 2017 URL: https://www.accessnow.org/five-eyes-governments-respond-coalition-demands-stop-undermining-encryption/ Abstract: Status update on the Five Eyes governments’ position on encryption
